title: Go for windows - Incompatibility with Sophos: virus spyware message when executing the go .exe file
body:
by **mehdi.khoury**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.have sophos installed running on a windows XP computer
2.8g HelloWorld.go
3.8l -o HelloWorld.exe HelloWorld.8
4.HelloWorld.exe 
5. gives output : access to file denied

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
it triggers an identification from sophos as the virus/spyware Mal/Krap-I 
trying to execute a go .exe file (I tried with the HelloWorld.exe example)
and sophos prevent the file from executing...


What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
GOOS is mingw
GOARCH is 386

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
MinGW-32 build of Go release 2010-04-27	 
and
MinGW-32 build of Go release 2010-04-13

Please provide any additional information below.
The only way for me to execute the HelloWorld.exe is to desactivate Sophos 
completely ( unplug my internet cable and then Control+Alt+delete  and 
desactivate any process that contains the name sav).
Problem with that is it prevents any computer to run sophos and keep an 
internet connection running while working on go programming at the same 
time. Most of academic networks (in uk anyway) use sophos antivirus...
It would be nice to find a different trick that would allow to run go 
programs while keeping sophos on.

Best regards.
